posts.post_content:
A tad expensive, and it's kinda forcing you to play mono-blue (or blue-supported artifact), but it seems pretty solid to me, espcially with all the library rearranging blue (and various artifacts) can do, in standard and beyond.
  
   
Combo with the new [Ponder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ponder), [Preordain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Preordain), [Crystal Ball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystal Ball) or an old classic [Scroll Rack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scroll Rack), my all time favorite deck manager.
posts.html:
A tad expensive, and it's kinda forcing you to play mono-blue (or blue-supported artifact), but it seems pretty solid to me, espcially with all the library rearranging blue (and various artifacts) can do, in standard and beyond.

Combo with the new Ponder, Preordain, Crystal Ball or an old classic Scroll Rack, my all time favorite deck manager.

posts.post_content: He combos pretty good with [Vengeful Pharaoh](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vengeful Pharaoh), whose weakness is that the opponent will know what you will be drawing when the Pharaoh get's topdecked . Use the Djinn's ability to save yourself one mana to cast the Pharaoh during upkeep, get him out, and also not mess up your draw.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
What about using him in EDH/Commander? I'm just building my first EDH deck, but he seems like you could put him to some use in a format where games last longer and decks are filled with high-CMC bombs.
  
My [Intet, the dreamer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Intet, the dreamer) deck already has a lot of topdeck manipulation (duh, look who's the general) with stuff like [Crystal Ball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crystal Ball) and recurring [Halimar Depths](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Halimar Depths) and a lot of hideously fat spells to cheat into play.
